Finding creative ways to die all the way from hotkeying my doors open, panicking, and forgetting about the 'pause' function on run #1, to exploding the enemy ship with my entire crew aboard it on run #30. Clearly one of the best roguelikes of all time. 

Took me a while to get to because of the famed difficulty, but in reality you have the mechanics of the ship and the combat locked down in like 3 runs. Everything else is adapting your strategy around lessons learned in failure. The dark souls of roguelikes.

I feel like I might accrue so much stress that all my hair will fall out. 185869635.review:
This game is a roguelike, which I love, space-based, which I love, that plays with making decisions, which I love... but everything is completely ruined by both, RNG, and the frustrating difficulty it was made to have. Would you like to miss 6 shots in a row? You can do it with relative ease. Would you like to get nailed by every missile the enemy shoots seemingly for an infinite amount? This game has that. Would you like to have your systems cripped with a single laser hit? Granted. Would you like to lack the resources to get anywhere close to your enemies? Obviously. 

Unless you think being frustrated 90% of the time and having fun a 10% of the time where RNG favors you makes for a good game, then this game is a waste of time. Which is unfortunate cuz I love the art style and the music, and the concept in general.

185692326.review: A classic of the roguelike genre, FTL: Faster Than Light is a perfect example of many simple mechanics synergizing to create a master-class game.  I'm convinced that this is as close as a game can get to completely perfect (at least mechanics-wise).  The gameplay, aesthetics, lore, and music all hit that sweet spot, leaving the player enthralled with an experience that I have yet to see replicated to this extent.  If you're looking for a roguelike and haven't played FTL, then I highly suggest giving this modern classic a go.  You absolutely won't regret it.

185612129.review: No beating around the bush. simply a great strategy game

185608340.review:
FTL: Faster Than Light is a masterclass in strategic gameplay and emergent storytelling. As captain of your own starship, you must navigate a hostile galaxy, balancing resource management, tactical combat, and crew survival. Each decision—whether to engage in battle, aid a stranded ship, or upgrade your systems—carries weight, often leading to thrilling or heartbreaking outcomes.

The game’s retro aesthetic and evocative soundtrack perfectly complement its roguelike structure, making every run feel fresh and unpredictable. While the punishing difficulty may deter some players, it also enhances the sense of accomplishment when you outsmart a tough encounter or scrape by with your ship barely intact.

FTL thrives on the stories you create through its gameplay. Each jump through hyperspace is a chapter in a gripping, player-driven narrative. It's a must-play for fans of strategy and sci-fi.

185491611.review: This is one of my favorite games of all time.  It's endlessly replayable with lots of hidden achievements and things to unlock, and even a decade later there's a ton of mods out there to keep things fresh for people that can't get enough.  The soundtrack, pixel graphics, gameplay... everything is top notch.  One of the best games to come out of the indie renaissance of the 2010s and the whole kickstarter era of games.

185466128.review:
Buen juego, basicamente te va contando una historia con distintas opciones a lo largo de los sistemas/sectores en los que vamos navegando. 

En normal es bastante dificil, siento que depende bastante de cada manera de jugar y del factor suerte. A veces puedes perder en el 5to sector como en el 2ndo simplemente porque no encontraste una tienda, te quedaste sin chatarra, etc. 

No es un juego para todo el mundo, hay que leer e imaginarse varias situaciones (o por lo menos es lo que me gusta a mi) 

La unica queja creo que seria el hecho de que varias veces es repetitivo (suelen salir las mismas misiones), pero es algo un poco obvio que va a suceder si lo juegas muchas veces (asumo que por eso igual esta el dlc). 

De todas formas he perdido de diversas maneras y cada vez me sorprende más como puedo ser invadido por 4 mantis, mientras el sol quema mi nave y la nave enemiga tiene 4 armas y 2 drones en el sector 3. Es increible. 

Me gusta mucho y lo seguire jugando. Un juego simple pero bastante completo/complejo a la larga.

This game is extremely frustrating. It really is for the crowd "losing is fun" or people who are masochist. Personally, I don't feel RNG is the only thing screwing with you since if you get in a good enough spot (i.e. your ship has good upgrades) the game will then proceed to throw a battle that you can't win.

I understand if I lose due to my own incompetence but Imagine the enemy sending 4 to 7 boarders to your ship while you only have like 3 to 5 crews. On top of that, the enemy is attacking you with their own ship with missiles that bypass shields or with overwhelming number of weapons (3 to 4). 

Normally, you would have to escape those battles but the enemy tends to target your engines/cockpit which prevents you from escaping. You die and all that time is wasted because of the bullshit.

185209353.review:
It's a very fun, unique and interesting game but it can cause you high levels of frustration. I warn you: You throw yourself against the game again and again and again and the only way to succeed is pure luck. Let me give an example: you're at sector four, enemy ships have 2 or 3 level shields here and you have your default beam weapon because the stores along the way had no strong guns. This way you just gonna shoot AND NOT PENETRATE enemy shields and your only solution is to jump away because you are not causing damage to enemy ships. So you do the jumping away from fights strategy until: 1. you get defeated before you jump away, 2. you run out of fuel, 3. you run out of credits and point 1. happens, 4. some magical interaction happens on the way (you rescue a ship and they give you a weapon as a reward).
And that's it. The ship you choose at the beginning very much determines at which from the 10 sectors you gonna get stuck 95% of the play-throughs until luck brings it that way that this time you manage till the end of the game.
This game is a scratch-card. You keep playing it because sometimes you win a buck or two but 95% of the times you are just scratching and scratching.

184846115.review:
FTLは「1回やりきり型」のゲームで、ストーリー性は薄めながらも、独特の魅力があります。似たようなゲームに「Slay the Spire」がありますが、FTLの方が自分にはしっくりきました。今まで遊んだゲームの中で最高の作品であり、これを超えるゲームはないと感じています。

このゲームの特徴は、ランダム要素の強さにあります。運に左右されてどうにもならない場面もありますが、それこそが「宇宙での戦い」のリアルさを表現していると感じます。宇宙という極限の環境では、生物が簡単に死んでしまうという緊張感が魅力です。

良い点：
	•	プレイ時間をコントロール可能：好きなタイミングでゲームを一時停止できる。
	•	豊富なランダムイベント：予測不能な展開が続き、毎回新鮮な体験ができる。
	•	分かりやすいゲーム性：複雑なコンボがなく、直感的に遊べる。
	•	選択のジレンマ：何を改造するか、何を購入するか、常に悩ましい選択がある。
	•	緊迫感とリラックスの両立：緊張感のある戦闘を楽しみつつ、ゆっくり遊べる設計。

気になる点：
	•	操作性について：以前iPad版でプレイしていた際、タッチ操作が非常に快適だったのが印象的だった。今回Steam版を購入したが、マウスとキーボード操作には少し慣れが必要で、最初はやや戸惑った。


FTLは、宇宙でのサバイバルや戦いを体験できる、没入感のあるゲームです。

戦艦やキャラクターの名前を自由に設定できるので、自分好みの名前をつけて物語を楽しんでみてください。

以下は、ゲーム内イベントをもとに作ったストーリーの一例です。興味がある人は読んでみてください。


 [spoiler] 
宇宙船「ラッキースター号」――コクピット

燃料ゲージの赤いランプが点滅を繰り返している。まるで「次はどうするつもり？」と問い詰められているかのようだ。

「ゼロ、燃料の残量は？」
AIのゼロが冷静に応答する。「燃料残量ゼロ。FTLジャンプは不可能です。」

「30分か……。」私はため息をついた。「救助信号を送るわよ。」

「救助信号って、危険すぎない？」兵器管制室からタミーの声が飛んでくる。「誰が応じるかも分からないのに。」

「だから、その時は戦うのよ。」私は冷静を装いながらも、次の展開を予感していた。



数分後、レーダーに反応が現れた。画面に映し出されたのはスラグの商船だ。体中が粘液で覆われたその姿は、不快以外の何物でもない。

「救助信号に応じたのがスラグなんて……最低の幸運ね。」タミーが皮肉交じりに笑う。

通信が繋がると、画面にスラグ商人の顔が映った。
「燃料が必要なんでしょう？ちょうどいい取引がありますよ。」
声は不自然に滑らかで、何か裏があるのが明らかだった。



「燃料5ユニットを15スクラップで提供します。」スラグ商人がにやりと笑った。
「取引しましょう。」私はやむを得ず承諾した。画面上では、燃料がタンクに補充される様子が表示される。

「さて、追加の話ですが。」スラグ商人が不気味な笑顔を浮かべる。「手数料として、ミサイル1発とスクラップ10をいただきます。」

「そんな契約、どこにもなかったはずよ！」私は声を荒げた。
「契約内容は柔軟に変わるものです。」

私はその場で通信を切った。スラグ商人は哄笑しながら去っていった。



さらに別のスラグ商船が接近してきた。こちらは最初の商人よりも堂々としている。

「燃料5ユニットを50スクラップ、10ユニットなら95スクラップで販売します。」
「50スクラップですって？それはぼったくりよ！」
「このセクターで燃料を買えるのは、我々だけだ。」商人は挑発するような笑みを浮かべている。

「少しでも値引きできないかしら？」私は交渉を試みた。

しかし、スラグ商人は激怒した。「侮辱された気分だ！価格交渉は受け付けない！」通信が切れると同時に、敵船が攻撃を開始した。



「戦闘態勢！」私は操縦席から叫ぶ。
「敵船、ビーム兵器とミサイルを搭載！」ゼロが冷静に報告する。

「シールドがダウンしました！」カイルがエンジンルームから声を上げる。
「武器システム、準備は？」私は兵器管制室にいるタミーに呼びかけた。
「バーストレーザー、発射準備完了よ！」

「ゼロ、狙いを分析して。」
「敵船のシールドが35%の効率で稼働中。エンジンを狙えば機動力を奪える確率は82%です。」

「タミー、エンジンを狙って！」

タミーが操作し、バーストレーザーが敵船のエンジンを直撃。続いて敵船が制御不能に陥る。



「敵船、完全に停止しました。」ゼロが報告する。
「燃料とスクラップを回収して！」私はすぐに指示を出した。

「燃料10、スクラップ30、それとミサイルが2発。」カイルが報告する。

「状況は最悪だけど、少しはマシになったわね。」私は皮肉っぽく笑った。

「ジャンプの準備完了！」ゼロが冷静に告げる。
「行くわよ、タミー。ワープポイントに向けてジャンプ！」

光が船体を包み込み、ラッキースター号は新しいセクターへと飛び立った。



「この船、本当に運がいいのか悪いのか分からないわね。」
タミーが苦笑いしながら言った。その声には、疲れと安心が入り混じっている。

「運がいいのよ。」
私はコクピットのスクリーン越しに映る新しい星々を見つめながら答えた。その瞬間、あの輝く星々が私たちを次の冒険へと誘っているように思えた。

タミーが首をかしげる。「どうしてそう言い切れるの？」

「だって、私たちまだ生きてるもの。」

自分で言ったその言葉がコクピットの空気を変えたのを感じた。緊張の残り香が少しずつ薄れ、エンジンの低い唸り音だけが空間を満たしていく。船体がわずかに揺れたその振動さえも、私には次の冒険の予兆のように感じられた。

ゼロの冷静な声が、沈黙を破る。「次のセクターでの安全確率は18%。」

私は微笑んだ。「十分よ。」

心の中で自分にそう言い聞かせるようにもう一度つぶやきながら、操縦席の腕を少しだけ緩めた。星々が輝くその向こうへ、ラッキースター号は進み始める。その先に何が待ち受けているかなんて、誰にも分からないけど、少なくとも今、私たちはまだ生きている。それで十分だと思えた。

完

[/spoiler]

184645925.review: One of the first rogue-like games, FTL is lite science fiction ship vs. ship simulator with a lot of capacity for modding and expansion. Sadly, its RNG elements make apects of play sometimes impossible. You can get 1 hour into a run and never find a Shop with the weapons you need, for instance. Other times, you are get into situations with multiple high level threats right from Sector 1 without any chance to lessen the impact. Overall, good, but be warned the RNG will really mess with you sometimes.

184631307.review:
FTL: Faster Than Light is one of the BEST games ever HANDS DOWN. 

Allow me to say, i'm an old player of this game. I've played for around 200 hours on my old account and I had not gotten bored once. While I don't play FTL that much nowadays, it's one of those games that has had such an impact on me as a person it actively shaped me at least a little bit to who I am today. 

The gameplay is simple, effective and fun. You have to travel to a variety of locations, some of which will see your Vessel boarded by pirates, Have you ambushed by Mantis or Slavers or worst of all.... you find a station with giant alien spiders. The fights themselves are, in my opinion, phenomenal and one of a kind. Of course you have your trade offs, you sacrifice someone who is stationed at the engine so that he can go to weapons, or you move two of your guys and gals from the Cameras or doors to your teleporter and settle things close and personal. The weapons are no joke either, almost all of them are completely viable (almost). My favourites are the Laser machine gun (I think it was called Vulcan?), The Fire beam and by by by far the glaive beam and the anti-bio beam. 

The way you unlock new "outfits" and ships is also smart. Connected to events and challenges, my own personal favourite being the Lanius ship (I love the idea of the Lanius as a race in general) and the Federation cruiser. If I had one complaint in this department, it's that some ships are lacking or the event to unlock them is more fun that it is playing with them, like the stealth cruiser or (if i remember correctly) all 3 of the zoltan cruisers. But that is to be expected from such a variety, some ships are just better than others.

The world building? Immaculate. Muah, chef's kiss, 11/10. It's a self contained story, small and maybe inconsequential but it d o e s immerse you. And with the Series "Kestrel Adventures" (one of the most ambitious fan projects i've ever watched and had the pleasure to watch before it was over) you get a much deeper appreciation for the game. Though take my opinion with a grain of salt as I was raised with this game and I could have some rose tinted nostalgia glasses on. But for the life of me, when I started writing, I absolute loved the Zoltan and the Lanius as races. Living energy who power everything around them and living robots who eat scrap metal to survive, so advanced they suck the oxygen out of everything and have their own languages. Personally? I LOVE the Lanius, i'd go out of my way to play with their cruiser.

The music? Boy, if the world building and game play were good, this is leagues above it. The main menu music is THE stuff, I remember a friend back in 2020 being sick and tired and I told him "Open up FTL, listen to the menu music and go to dream land.". He did. And since then we've BOTH been nostalgic, despite he himself not being a fan of these strategic games. There's some who don't really slap but really that's like, 10%, you'll be vibing your way through sector 5 like there's a rave. 

Replayability is also a factor FTL excels on. It's designed to be played ad infinitum, with different races and weapons to try out, not to even mention drones, hacking and what not. No complaints here. 

All in all - The game is awesome. But I do have one complaint, which is major but in no way a deal breaker. It's very, very hard to access the "DLC", and if someone doesn't have some outside source of knowledge about it, they wouldn't know it existed. It's such an RNG fest that I dedicated 10 hours in my old account and still never got to find the crystal biome in and of itself, much less the cruiser. I never even got to see the crystal man himself. But as i said, far from a game ender. 

In short -
Graphics: 10/10, style over graphics all the way
Music: 11/10
Gameplay: 9/10
Replayability: 10/10

All in all, the perfect game to pour your heart on. It can run on a potato (Or even Glados!) and it will be one of the few games i'd keep to play if I was to have to choose 5 games to play forever. 10/10.

184589965.review:
This game is incredibly fair, in the sense that you and the enemy have the exact same tools at your disposal. The only difference is your choice of upgrades, crew commands, and power usage. Who would have guessed that the guy with maxed evasion, systems, and weapons wins? The Federation is a joke because clearly the rebels are getting bankrolled.

But really, the enemy firepower and defense is overwhelming and nothing but the luckiest runs stand a chance on hard-mode. Play on easy if you are intent on buying.

Edit: YOU JESTER AWARDING MOTHERFUCKER I JUST DIED TO THE SECOND FLAGSHIP EVENT LIKE 5 MINUTES AGO

184025931.review:
Fun space oregon trail roguelike that emphasises on rerouting power to different systems while also managing starship battles. There's a lot of flexibility in how you can play this game, be it boarding, killing the enemy crew with fire, retreating bad situations, sending drones to fight for you, and good ol fire all weapons until the ship blows up. As you keep playing, you'll start to recognise certain scenarios you should just outright avoid (giant spiders are a huge nope). You'll also unlock plenty of other ships, each with different starting kits to feel like a whole new character.

The free dlc is great but also makes the game easier. I'd still recommend it as the game is already difficult and having more variety is always a good thing.

I've owned this game for a while and I find myself replaying it every few years. It's just a comfy stressful game.

184023569.review: I'm loving it. It's so simple, yet so addictive... the game offers you many different and equally viable strategies to buid your crew and spaceship, which not only gives endless potential for replay, it will make you *want* to replay a different way. Also, the soundtrack is a definite classic, up there with Minecraft's in my opinion! If you haven't tried it yet, well, you've missed out!

183937194.review:
Seriously hardcore strategy that will keep you on your toes with random events, and also the many ways your ship systems and crew can fail you.

Thinking ahead is key, and having plans for disasters is crucial.

I've been told playing on Easy is like playing on Normal, and playing on Normal is like playing on Hard, and I have to agree, because I have yet to beat a run in Normal after 37 hours. Maybe it's a skill issue, maybe it's just that hardcore.

If you like methodical, yet still heated strategy games with huge gambling elements, this is for you.

183923147.review: Rogue-like with a lot of depth. The final boss is punishingly hard, even on easy. After 80+ hours, I think I've managed to beat the boss with one of the many ships.

183902261.review: A timeless classic. it is just good, I don't know how else to describe it.

183884717.review:
A masterpiece of the genre, FTL is immersive, charming, never boring and damn hard.
The gameplay challenging, but never obscure, you just need to understand when to play it safe and when to risk it. Of course, RNG is involved, but with practice you can overcome almost any catastrophic event, runs are short anyways.
The art is minimalistic, as it should be for this kind of game, the music is wonderfully crafted to suit every event and the writing is brilliant.
Even without mods the title has a huge replay value, is cheap and takes close to zero space on your device, it's a game to always keep there ready to go and squish a run or two in your busy days.
Totally recommended

183848177.review:
this is one of the best games for school or work. Almost all of my hours are from playing this game during class.
the game can auto pause when the tab is not active so quick alt-tabs don't end your run
you can save the game at any point and immediately jump back into a run, meaning you can always sneak in a few minutes of this game here and there if you want, and if your rudely interrupted you can always start right back where you left off.
the entire game can easily be played with a touchpad so you don't need to haul around a mouse to play this game.
the game is very unintensive and any work laptop could run this easy.
and lastly its fun as hell and infinitely replayable.
This game is an absolute must buy, especially if you frequently travel or want to slack off during work/school. I have yet to find a better game more suited to wasting time when I shouldn't, thats also still a blast to play and come back to.

183704059.review:
这是一款小且精妙的肉鸽lite+太空科幻游戏，让很久都没有碰到使人眼前一亮的游戏的我感到了久违的满足。我是懒狗所以测评很少，但这个游戏的优秀让我愿意专门给它来上好评。
优点：①优秀的战斗机制和资源管理（能量），二者在战斗中相辅相成。很简单的敌我两艘舰艇战斗，但是其中需要思考的变量完全不亚于回合制游戏，空格儿暂停思考下一秒武器射击的顺序及打击目标和电量该因为敌人的行动而被分配到哪个系统更是和呼吸一样常见。
          ②多样化的游玩风格，激光齐射抑或是无人机群，导弹巨炮还是跳帮肉搏都在这游戏里有一席之地。舰船是用力均衡攻守兼备，蓝盾绿盾重装上阵抑或是隐身突袭而舍弃防御？虽然肯定有强有弱，但是制作组留下了足够多可供发挥的空间。
          ③合理的难度分级。更高难度下电脑的表现完全不是无脑数值的堆砌，而是实实在在地变“聪明”了。困难难度下的敌人会尽可能地调整攻击目标对玩家造成尽可能大的干扰和杀伤。
          ④可圈可点的音乐，boss战的时候确实是让人酣畅淋漓。
          ⑤内容扎实到完全可以当做dlc出售的高级版登录游戏点击就送（当然这个游戏本来也不是很贵就是了）
缺点：①武器之间存在着比较严重的不平衡，萌新前期没有拿到比较趁手的激光（比如爆裂 II）的话战斗会显得很困难，死于空有一堆导弹武器但没有导弹可用令人憋屈（现身说法了属于是）。
          ②略显阴间的隐藏船解锁条件。在一局要超过一小时的游戏里可能要到最后十分钟才会发现“这局条件不够不能解锁水晶船，前几十分钟的努力全部木大”，让人心烦。
个人评分：9.5/10 假如让我在某个不支持小数的评分网站打分的话，我在9和10之间会更倾向于10。
话说这游戏是我买这个制作组另外一款游戏时看到同捆包只多了5块就能喜加2顺手买的，结果无心插柳柳成荫，令人感叹。

183682869.review: Perfect balance of randomness and variety.

183681707.review:
The single best spaceship game out there. 

Wanna feel like Picard in his hayday? This is the way.

183671426.review: looks simple but in fact it's challenging. everything is random and this makes the game fun!

183649414.review:
完全无敌的BOSS设计，不管再胡的设备也会大概率被BOSS一轮齐射直接送走，而且毫无操作空间
经常是前期辛苦运营一整局最后在BOSS面前当小丑

183644811.review: One of many rogue-like games that I enjoy playing to kill the time or to test myself on how far my ship could survive. It provides the player with a lot of encounter possibilities with the freedom to thread our own path, based on our luck and calculation. Definitely a "must try".

183632310.review: great game. get the multiverse mod... opens up a lot of stuff. RNG based.

183625753.review: this games hates you in the best way possible

183611579.review:

183540491.review: What else would you play, stuck floating in space?

183537325.review: Amazing rogue-like game. A variety of ships to fly, crew to run the ship, and load-outs for weapons/defenses. Different little stories and choices to make - do you attack the unknown vessel or leave it alone? Well worth the 26 hours I've played so far.
